1.1: Elder Gaius to the beloved, whom I love in truth.
1.2: Beloved, I wish for everything to bless you and get well, as your soul is blessed.
1.3: For there was much joy in the coming of brothers and witnesses to the truth, just as you walk in the truth.
1.4: I have no greater joy than these, to hear that we are children walking in the truth.
1.5: Beloved, you are faithful, what if you work for the brothers and this strangers,
1.6: who testified to your love in front of the church, you who do well are worthy of God;
1.7: because for the sake of the name they went out receiving nothing from the Gentiles.
1.8: We, therefore, must undertake such things, so that we may become accomplices to the truth.
1.9: He wrote what to the church, but their patron Diotrephes does not accept us.
1.10: for this reason, if I come, I will remind him of the works he is doing, the words of our wicked gossips; and not being satisfied with this, even he admits the brothers and the obstinate, obstructs and expels from the church.
1.11: Beloved, do not imitate evil but good.  He who does good is from God; he who does evil has not blessed God.
1.12: To Demetrius he testifies of everything and of the truth; and we also bear witness, and you have seen that our testimony is true.
1.13: Many have been written to you, but I do not want them to write to you with ink and reed;
1.14: I hope they will see you directly, and we will talk mouth to mouth.
